intro: Macodes cominsii, commonly known as the Comins' orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers, which can be pink or white, are often fragrant and attract various pollinators.
